add # -_\- coding: utf-8 -_\- #  at the first line of example/settings.py

title: the verb "regroup" in the upgrade procedure
body:
**Originally created by Louis-Dominique Dubeau on 2013-02-06T18:00:08Z**

http://docs.modoboa.org/getting_started/upgrade.html

The verb "to regroup" in "This section regroups all the upgrade procedures..." looks extremely awkward. Je dirais que regroup a l'air drôlement français dans cette phrase. Something like "This section covers all the upgrade procedures..." would be idiomatic English. 

Whereas in French the "re" prefix in regroup can indicate completeness of the group, in English it only has the meaning of "again" so to regroup is to group again, implying that the procedures are also grouped somewhere else or that they were grouped, became scattered and then were grouped again.

title: Modal form: help links issue
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2013-02-06T15:45:49Z**

When we click on a link (?) to display help, it modifies the current location. The default link action is not stopped.

title: The log parser fails to detect valid lines
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2013-01-31T13:13:19Z**

The regexp used to detect sent messages (and others) is wrong. It is looking for postfix queue IDs with a fixed size (between 9 and 18) whereas this size can be different.

title: Full table scan when using postgres
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2013-01-30T09:42:35Z**

It seems we missuse the .extra() method when building specific request to query the amavis table.

We need to manually specify the fields used to create joins!

title: Permissions not applied to users imported from LDAP
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2013-01-27T14:34:27Z**

Per-object permissions are not applied to users/mailboxes/domains imported from LDAP.

title: Bad behaviour when mysql and postgres are used in the same time
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2013-01-26T14:59:19Z**

Modoboa uses the wrong database engine to build SQL queries.

title: Message subject not well converted
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2013-01-21T14:27:16Z**

The message listing sometimes fails because it tries to convert subjects (type: str) to utf-8 by default.

title: A user can disable itself
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2013-01-19T17:59:36Z**

A user shouldn't be able to disable its account. The worst case concerns super administrators : if the last one disable its account, modo becomes unavailable!

title: Removing an account or a domain may leave orphan entries
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2013-01-14T21:40:08Z**

Due to bad relations handling (from modo and django), removing such objects may leave orphan entries into the db.

For example, removing a domain will potentially leave empty fowards.

title: Some RFC2047 headers are not properly decoded
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2013-01-10T19:44:08Z**

The internal converted sometimes fails to decode specific headers.

title: Potential issue when using default parameter value
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2013-01-02T15:16:55Z**

There is a mistake when displaying global parameters (ie. the administrative ones).

If a given parameter hasn't been defined yet, we try to display its default value using the "default" field whereas we should use the "deflt" one.

title: Cannot modify a super administrator when using postgres
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2012-12-25T09:13:12Z**

There is an issue when a super administrator is beeing modified. Actually, modo tries to promote the account to a super administrator once again!

MySQL doesn't say anything but PostgreSQL does.

title: History javascript plugins sends requests without encoding them
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2012-12-21T11:36:19Z**

The navigation plugin sends unencoded requests to the server (ie. without replacing special chars like '&')

This results in 404 errors on server side.

title: The bodystructure parser fails specific constructions
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2012-12-06T06:33:58Z**

When parentheses are present in parameters (ie. between 2 "), the parser treats them as regular parentheses and fails to find the end of the bodystructure.

title: amavis extension: internal error when deleting messages on last page of a multi-page quarantine
body:
**Originally created by Louis-Dominique Dubeau on 2012-10-26T12:31:31Z**

Modoboa version 0.9.3

(However it also happened with 0.9.2. Forgot to report it. Sorry.)

This is easily reproducible on my installation:
1. Wait until the quarantine is big enough to require more than one page to display.
2. Go to the last page of the quarantine.
3. Select some messages to delete and delete them.
4. Modoboa will display an "Internal error" message. (A red notification at the top of the page.)

I considered that maybe the problem is that if all the messages on the last page (let's call it page N) are deleted Modoboa still tries to display page N instead of page N-1 and fails because page N no longer exists since all the messages that would be on it have been deleted. However, the error happens even if only a subset of messages on page N are deleted and thus _still_ exists after the deletion operation.

title: Cannot define an empty quota
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2012-10-21T18:53:16Z**

The quota field (domain, mailbox) is mandatory but some people doesn't want to define quota.

Allow people to enter an empty quota, using a special value like -1.

title: incompatibility with amavisd-new
body:
**Originally created by Hervé Cauwelier on 2012-10-21T14:54:35Z**

Hi, while installing amavisd-new 2.8 for Modoba, I ran into this problem when applying migration "amavis:0002_create_records":

django.db.utils.DatabaseError: ERREUR:  la colonne « spam_modifies_subj » de la relation « policy » n'existe pas
LINE 1: ...recip", "spam_kill_level", "clean_quarantine_to", "spam_modi...

The problem is that this column was dropped in version 2.8, quoting README.sql-pg.txt:

Table 'policy' received a couple of new optional fields with 2.7.0, and
dropped one field. As all fields in this table are optional and any extra
field is just ignored by amavisd, it is not necessary to update this table
unless one really needs these new fields. The following should adjust
a pre-2.7.0 schema:
  [...]
  ALTER TABLE policy DROP COLUMN spam_modifies_subj;

I din't find it in the Policy model but I had to edit the migration and remove references to "spam_modifies_subj" in the query and in the frozen models definition.

title: amavis extension does not manage policies in a way compatible with amavisd-new's own documentation
body:
**Originally created by Louis-Dominique Dubeau on 2012-09-06T12:34:53Z**

Modoboa version: 0.9.2
Amavisd-new version: 2.7.1

The documentation regarding SQL usage provided with amavisd-new suggests that multiple records in the users table should point to the same record in the policy table. Said documentation is here:

http://www.ijs.si/software/amavisd/README.sql-mysql.txt

Recipes helping sysadmins setting up amavisd-new for SQL suggest populating the policy table with useful values. Here is a typical example:

INSERT INTO policy (id, policy_name,
  virus_lover, spam_lover, banned_files_lover, bad_header_lover,
  bypass_virus_checks, bypass_spam_checks,
  bypass_banned_checks, bypass_header_checks, spam_modifies_subj,
  spam_tag_level, spam_tag2_level, spam_kill_level) VALUES
  (1, 'Non-paying',    'N','N','N','N', 'Y','Y','Y','N', 'Y', 3.0,   7, 10),
  (2, 'Uncensored',    'Y','Y','Y','Y', 'N','N','N','N', 'N', 3.0, 999, 999),
  (3, 'Wants all spam','N','Y','N','N', 'N','N','N','N', 'Y', 3.0, 999, 999),
  (4, 'Wants viruses', 'Y','N','Y','Y', 'N','N','N','N', 'Y', 3.0, 6.9, 6.9),
  (5, 'Normal',        'N','N','N','N', 'N','N','N','N', 'Y', -999, 6.9, 9.0),
  (6, 'Trigger happy', 'N','N','N','N', 'N','N','N','N', 'Y', 3.0,   5, 5),
  (7, 'Permissive',    'N','N','N','Y', 'N','N','N','N', 'Y', 3.0,  10, 20);

If an administrator manages multiple domains and all these domains require a policy corresponding to the "Normal" policy, then the administrator would have all of these domains point to the "Normal" policy record. E.g.:
- @foo.com in the table users points to policy "Normal" (id 5) in the table policy.
- @bar.com in the table users points to policy "Normal" (id 5) in the table policy.

Presumably, the idea is that if administrator decides to change what "Normal" means, then he does not have to go through all domains one by one. He just changes the "Normal" record in the policy table.

However, assuming the setup above, let's assume that an administrator adds Modoboa to his setup and uses Modoboa to alter the policy of foo.com.

Expected result: Only the settings of foo.com should change.

Actual result: Modoboa also _silently_ alters the settings of bar.com. There is nothing on screen indicating that what Modoboa is changing has an effect greater than foo.com. This is because Modoboa modifies the settings for foo.com by modifying the "Normal" record in the policy table. Thus, everything pointing to "Normal" is altered.

(I've considered whether filing this as a bug or a feature request. I've decided on a bug since the current behavior yields unexpected results.)

As an administrator what I would ideally want the amavis extension to do is handle the two tables --- users and policy --- in a way which is compatible with what the developers of amavisd-new intended. I should be able to:
- Create new policies. Delete policies. Edit policies. "Policies" here means "records in the policy table."
- Change the relationship between a user and a policy (e.g. get foo.com to use the 'Trigger happy' policy rather than 'Normal'.)

title: message selection on quarantine page not detecting change in shift status
body:
**Originally created by Louis-Dominique Dubeau on 2012-09-04T00:53:57Z**

Modoboa version: 0.9.2
Firefox version: 14.0.1

Steps to reproduce:
1. Wait until you have at least 5 message on your quarantine page. (Obviously, one or two message won't be enough to show the problem. 5 is a safe number to avoid borderline conditions.)
2. Click the first message.
3. Hold shift and click the last message. At this point, all message are selected.
4. Release shift. Click the middle message.

Actual result: All messages above the middle message are selected. That is, the list behaves as if shift were _still_ pressed.

Expected results: The only thing selected after step 4 should be the message you clicked on.

Observations: I am not sure what is going on but I put breakpoints on the keyup and keydown methods in jquery.htmltable.js and found that while keydown is executed, keyup is not. So it seems that the shift_pressed variable is not reset when shift is released.

title: if amavis extension fails to contact amavis, there is no clear error message.
body:
**Originally created by Louis-Dominique Dubeau on 2012-09-03T17:17:13Z**

Version: modoboa 0.9.2

Actual behavior: As of the date of this bug report, if Modoboa's amavis extension is unable to contact amavis to release an email from quarantine, the failure will occur silently. Initial investigation suggests that an exception is not trapped in the AMrelease object (in amavis/lib.py).

Expected behavior: It would be desirable for Modoboa to trap the failure and be vocal about it so that a) the user knows something went wrong and b) a sysadmin takes care of the problem.

Suggestions:
1. On the screen where the administrator sets the parameters for the amavis extension, provide the capability to test communications with amavis.
2. Use django's logging facility to log failures.
3. When a user releases a message and the release fails, give an informative error message.

Reference to the discussion in Google Groups:

https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/modoboa-users/fOxYhCDyw_o

title: Use of deprecated *spam_modifies_subj* field
case sensitive mail confusion
body:
**Originally created by Walter Doekes on 2012-07-16T09:45:43Z**

Hi,

no sane person wants case sensitive e-mail addresses (of which only the local part is sensitive).
Therefore we should always convert the email to lowercase before saving.
- Usernames are already case insensitive (on a default mysql install) with the auth backend, even when they get stored in upper case. We're not touching this for now.
- For forwards/aliases are a different matter. As the destination server may make a case distinction and if it doesn't, it will treat the e-mail as lowercase.

_For local accounts lowercase email should be considered as mandatory_

Why?
- Many tablets begin input fields with an upper case letter: Myname@mydomain.com.
- Dovecot will open the Maildir with the capital in it.
- Default postfix-dovecot-lda example shows master.cf flags=..hu, meaning lowercase folding of username (and domain) => files now get stored by LDA in "myname/" instead of "Myname/" (when we use userdb { ... allow_all_users=yes } on the lda).

Result: Myname-user doesn't get any mail, because it goes in myname-directory.

The hard fix is to ensure that all of postfix and/or dovecot preserves case along the way.
The easy fix is to fold the e-mail to lowercase at creation time and that is what the attached patch does.

The patch also does the following:
- make User searches case insensitive
- make User searches search for email as well

Regards,
Walter Doekes
OSSO B.V.

wsgiref==0.1.2

I first followed INSTALL but I got an error, see "first syncdb.txt" for the traceback and "first syncdb postgresql log.txt".

I then determined PostgreSQL was not recovering from a DatabaseError as you expected so I patched admin/**init**.py.

See "db_table_exists.patch", the "db_table_exists" functions comes from here: https://gist.github.com/527113/307c2dec09ceeb647b8fa1d6d49591f3352cb034

But then, as the migrations were running smoothly, it failed again, see "second syncdb.txt" and "second syncdb postgresql log.txt".

I continue looking for the cause of the error but your lights are welcome.

title: [dovecot] Invalid password scheme
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2012-05-25T08:34:38Z**

The scheme used for clear passwords (CLEAR) is not recognized by dovecot. It should have been PLAIN!

title: IMAP folder doesn't work with courier IMAP server
body:
**Originally created by Patrick Hetu on 2012-05-23T17:21:31Z**

The fallback "simple" fetching function doesn't list folders.

title: preferences url  and extensions form give errors
body:
**Originally created by Patrick Hetu on 2012-05-22T17:20:16Z**

reversing urls in templates need to include the full path to the views.

Was broken:
- /userprefs/preferences/ give me an url not found
- /admin/settings/parameters/ form action is empty

title: Modoboa doesn't use csrf token
body:
**Originally created by Patrick Hetu on 2012-04-17T18:27:26Z**

Since emails could hold sensitive data, I would suggest that you add the token to your form and activate the middleware to prevent Cross site request forgery attack.

title: Read only mailboxes
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2012-04-10T16:00:18Z**

Forbid delete and modify operations on default mailboxes (inbox, trash, drafts, junk, sent).

Currently, those operations are allowed and make the webmail crash!

title: 'Remember me' feature
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2012-04-07T13:18:36Z**

Add this feature to the login page.

title: View for quarantined mail
body:
**Originally created by Patrick Ben Koetter on 2012-04-05T21:40:38Z**

Separate quarantine reason (X-Amavis-Alert) from rest of mail. Use bootstrap alert-box to display reason. Display mail as mail.

title: Release:
body:
**Originally created by Patrick Ben Koetter on 2012-04-05T21:39:44Z**

Do not ask for confirmation, but present input element with recipients mail address, which could be modified by admin (to send it to herself). Pressing "Send" instead of "OK" implies the check whether a message should be released or not.

title: Release/Delete:
body:
**Originally created by Patrick Ben Koetter on 2012-04-05T21:39:14Z**

Use green button for "Release" and red button for "Delete" action.

title: Mail single view: "View full headers":
body:
**Originally created by Patrick Ben Koetter on 2012-04-05T21:38:25Z**

Do not use floating box. Show headers inline in TXT section.

title: Quarantine Navigation: Select
body:
**Originally created by Patrick Ben Koetter on 2012-04-05T21:37:39Z**

Change name "Select" for "Content Class".

title: Pending Requests Notification
body:
**Originally created by Patrick Ben Koetter on 2012-04-05T21:37:08Z**

Automatically update status via JS when logged in so Admin will see change even if she didn't request a new page.

title: Pending Requests
body:
**Originally created by Patrick Ben Koetter on 2012-04-05T21:36:42Z**

Move element to main navigation at top so OP or ADMIN can see and access it immediately when logged in.

title: Quarantine: Rows (E-Mails):
body:
**Originally created by Patrick Ben Koetter on 2012-04-05T21:36:18Z**

Highlight the text when hover/focus over row. Remove background highlight.

title: Quarantine: List Heading
body:
**Originally created by Patrick Ben Koetter on 2012-04-05T21:35:32Z**

Add a list heading per column.

title: Modoboa section: Extensions:
body:
**Originally created by Patrick Ben Koetter on 2012-04-05T21:35:01Z**

Remove checkbox from table heading.

title: Modoboa Section: Help text
body:
**Originally created by Patrick Ben Koetter on 2012-04-05T21:34:11Z**

Use a tool tip to show form element specific help text. Use a "?" icon to indicate help.

title: Form labels
body:
**Originally created by Patrick Ben Koetter on 2012-04-05T21:33:38Z**

Use the label element to create a clickable context between Label and Form element.

title: Modoboa section Form elements
body:
**Originally created by Patrick Ben Koetter on 2012-04-05T21:33:13Z**

Don't use Drop Downs for everything. Use radio boxes for multiple options. Checkbox for boolean options.

title: Word consistency
body:
**Originally created by Patrick Ben Koetter on 2012-04-05T21:32:03Z**

Use "enabled" and drop "active".

title: New Account
body:
**Originally created by Patrick Ben Koetter on 2012-04-05T21:31:39Z**

It is not obvious how a mail address will be added. Indicate a second step that will make it possible to add a mail address. Use a step indicator 1, 2 , ...

title: Bad Button
body:
**Originally created by Patrick Ben Koetter on 2012-04-05T21:30:33Z**

The delete button shows a close button and will mislead people to believe they can close/hide something. Find a better button.

title: Identities
body:
**Originally created by Patrick Ben Koetter on 2012-04-05T21:30:00Z**

An account should be editable simply by clicking on the username.

title: Information overflow
body:
**Originally created by Patrick Ben Koetter on 2012-04-05T21:27:59Z**

Created and Last modified should not be part of the domain listing. They should only be shown if someone requests a detailed listing (edit) of the domain.

title: Bad Delete Icon
body:
**Originally created by Patrick Ben Koetter on 2012-04-05T21:27:28Z**

The delete button shows a close button and will mislead people to believe they can close/hide something. Find a better button.

title: Editing Domains
body:
**Originally created by Patrick Ben Koetter on 2012-04-05T21:27:01Z**

A domain should be editable simply by clicking on the domain name.

title: New Domain/Edit Domain box
body:
**Originally created by Patrick Ben Koetter on 2012-04-05T21:26:00Z**

The box takes too long to slide in. A nice effect at first glance, but it keeps you from getting things done when you see the effect the second time.

title: The 'compose form' validation is broken
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2012-02-02T14:36:33Z**

1/ When a mandatory field is missing (to, subject), error messages appear but the top message ("Loading...") doesn't disappear
2/ Because of error messages, the 'attachments' bar disappear
3/ A strange 'GET' request is sent to 'webmail/pics/attachments.png'

title: Remove empty lines before the DOCTYPE tag
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2012-02-02T10:10:35Z**

Because of the way django templates are handled, empty lines are inserted before the DOCTYPE tag. It is not well supported by IE.

title: Encoding problem with parameters
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2012-02-02T08:47:18Z**

Currently, parameters are converted to string, escaped and saved into the database. It is working well with special characters :p

title: Bad behaviour with non defined quotas
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2012-01-23T09:50:54Z**

The webmail doesn't consider the case where quotas are available on the server but are not defined for some users.

title: Problem with passwords that contain non-ascii caracters
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2011-12-28T10:53:32Z**

Passwords that contain non-ascii caracters are translated to unicode strings by python but the crypto module uses strings. The encrypt function padds the clear password to make its length a multiple of 16 but using a unicode object :p

The size of a unicode object is twice the size of a string one so the resulting string lenght is not correct.

title: Missing configuration to use dovecot's LDA
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2011-11-22T08:59:16Z**

I forgot the dovecot service in the master.cf file.

title: On page refresh, a GET request is sent twice
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2011-11-14T16:07:02Z**

In the webmail and the quarantine plugin, on a full listing refresh (F5 is pressed), a GET request to the base url is send twice (ie. /webmail/ or /quarantine/).

It is not really optimized :p

title: Error in sample settings file
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2011-11-09T10:57:29Z**

The default value of the _DATABASE_ROUTER_ parameter is invalid.

title: Error in main.cf
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2011-11-06T21:47:39Z** Replace: 
smtp_recipient_restrictions
by 
smtpd_recipient_restrictions

title: Top redirection : update issue
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2011-11-01T08:55:10Z**

When an extension is being enabled/disabled, the list available for the _DEFAULT_TOP_REDIRECTION_ parameter is not updated.

+Solution+: register new callbacks on [[ExtEnabled]] & [[ExtDisabled]] events.

title: Ajax mode : bad behaviour if a session timeout is configured
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2011-10-26T15:08:07Z**

It is possible to define a timeout for opened sessions. (Django feature)

When a session times out, "ajax" based applications do not redirect users to the login page until a full refresh is done. Is it certainly due to the fact that we do not handle redirections for ajax calls...

title: Renaming a mailbox does not work properly
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2011-06-29T08:07:10Z**

The rename operation is still using the old way of organising directories. After a rename, the path field for the modified mailbox will have the value "domain/mailbox/" instead of "mailbox/". The result is that emails can no longer be delivered by the LDA for this mailbox.

title: Navigation history is lost
body:

I think it is related to ticket #141.

title: Display errors correctly
body:

Currently, errors encountered by the webmail are not displayed. We're just getting an infinite "Loading..." messsage :p

It is due to the fact query errors are discard. We must handle the 'OnFailure' event correctly. (I'm talking about ajax requests)

body:

title: Strange lastupdate value...
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2011-01-08T15:14:38Z**

It seems logparser.py sometimes put wrong lastupdate times inside RRD files. (for example on koalabs, around the new year, lastupdate of all RRD files has changed from 31/12/2010 to 31/12/2011 in one night!).

The result is really annoying : all future updates to theses files will failed until next year :p

title: Missing subfolders
body:

body:

The bar is currently out of the page.

title: Mailbox quota can be greater than the maximum limit
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2010-12-24T13:19:40Z**

A mailbox quota should not be greater than the one defined for the associated domain.

title: Cannot specify an SMTPS connection
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2010-12-21T08:36:04Z**

With the current settings interface, the only supported secured mode is starttls. Modoboa must support all modes:
- clear connect to port 25 and use a SMTP object),
- starttls (connect to port 25, use a SMTP object and send a "starttls" command),
- smtps (connect to port 465 and use a SMTP_SSL object).

It sounds easy but actually the way settings are managed prevents us to support both modes. I think the easiest way to achieve that is to replace the checkbox by a selectbox which will contain "SSL/TLS or STARTTLS".

title: Modifying a domain does not update associated mailboxes
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2010-12-20T08:27:11Z**

Because of the current schema, some information inside mailboxes is not updated (like path of full_address). A quick fix would be to browse all the mailboxes and to apply modifications. A cleaner way would be to change the underlying schema to make it more relational. (for example, by removing the full_address field and the path relative to the domain's one).

title: Make a distinction between local and remote images
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2010-12-10T10:37:21Z**

When sending an HTML message, all potential images are attached. Actually, this is only relevant for local images (like ckeditor emotes). We should not try to attach remote images.

body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2010-04-29T16:15:28Z**

When emails are selected, dragged and not dropped (ie. action is cancelled), some emails disappear if you click on them!

There is also a problem with the 'select all' checkbox. I think the thead raw is counted like a normal raw when dragging the selection... (the messages count is not correct).

Actions like move or mark are not working if all emails are selected.

title: finish "Mark messages" menu
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2010-04-20T08:09:03Z**

finish "Mark messages" menu

title: [amavis_quarantine] display headers when viewing an email
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2010-04-20T07:37:13Z**

In viewmail, headers are no more displayed.

title: Mailbox passwords are crypted (not MD5)
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2010-04-12T07:47:13Z**

Actually, passwords are always crypted...

title: Mailbox password cannot be updated
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2010-04-12T07:28:27Z**

From the admin view, password modification on a mailbox is not effective.

title: UID and GID are always fixed to 500
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2010-04-12T07:03:29Z**

Reported by Myrdhin on the list :

When i create a new mailbox, UID and GID in database are always set to
500...

I think UID and GID of the mailbox in database should be set to
VIRTUAL_UID and VIRTUAL_GID to work correctly with maildir folder
owned by virtual user/group (like vmail).

title: [statistics] selector issue from admin menu
body:
**Originally created by Florent  Dionisi on 2009-11-27T16:15:15Z**

From statistic page (admin menu).
When selecting new period of stats, the domain selected changes from X to "global".
=> one could expect the domain to remain the same while changing the period.

Same issue when selecting another domain, the period change from X to day!!

title: [postfix_autoreply] plugin conversion
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2009-10-27T16:43:54Z**

Try to convert this pseudo plugin into a real plugin :
1. Move views/models/forms outside main/

title: [general] Add a notification area inside the main layout
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2009-10-22T16:28:02Z**

The idea is to display status messages (ok, error, ...) returned by administration actions (add/delete/modify).

This area could be located to the right of the title (inside middle div), on the same line.

title: [permissions] Do not mix super admin role with other roles
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2009-10-22T16:24:25Z**

When the admin role has been granted to a user, do not allow the definition of an other role (like domain administrator) for this user. It's simply useless.

title: [permissions] Add a confirmation message when deleting permissions
body:
**Originally created by Antoine Nguyen on 2009-10-22T16:17:44Z**

[permissions] Add a confirmation message when deleting permissions
